pageContext.description: A cast copper alloy socketed spearhead with one loop missing, and dating from the Middle Bronze Age, about 1550 - 1250 BC. Davis Group 6, 'developed side looped'. The surviving loop is a projecting shallow arch through which string or cord would pass to attach the spear head to the shaft. The blade is leaf shaped with a sub-lozenge shaped midrib section with a groove on each side of the rib. The midrib extends to the tip of the narrow blade. The spear head has had a small notch taken out of one edge at the mid point. This was done during removal from the ground. The spear head is suffering from active bronze disease.
